alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 5:26AM MDT until June 16 at 6:04AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the St. Joe River...including St Maries...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 31.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and crest near 33.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon or Wednesday night. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM PDT.
